canonical_explanation.text: Acids are substances that taste sour and turn blue litmus red. Common acids include hydrochloric acid (HCl), sulfuric acid (H2SO4), and citric acid found in lemons. Bases are substances that taste bitter, feel soapy, and turn red litmus blue. Common bases include sodium hydroxide (NaOH) and calcium hydroxide (Ca(OH)2). Indicators are substances that show different colors in acidic and basic solutions. Litmus is a common indicator - red litmus turns blue in bases, and blue litmus turns red in acids. When an acid reacts with a base, they neutralize each other to form salt and water. This is called a neutralization reaction.
rules: Acids taste sour and turn blue litmus red
Bases taste bitter, feel soapy, and turn red litmus blue
Indicators show different colors in acids and bases
Red litmus turns blue in base
Blue litmus turns red in acid
Natural indicators include turmeric and red cabbage juice
Phenolphthalein is colorless in acid and pink in base
Methyl orange is red in acid and yellow in base
